para.text: If the user has entered a formula that is invalid, the formula will be reset to a default value when an attempt is made to evaluate it. The
dialog box shows what formulas have been reset. The
dialog box is displayed by selecting
It is also shown automatically if an invalid formula is detected.
The messages can be copied to the clipboard by clicking the
button or saved to a text file by clicking the

Normally, ModelMuse prevents the user from entering an invalid formula; however, a formula that was valid can become invalid if the data type or evaluation location of a data set that is included in the formula is changed or if the ModelMuse project file is edited outside of ModelMuse.
